title.narrative: Call-Off for an evaluation of ICTJ Project in Colombia 2015-2018
Call-off för utvärdering av ICTJ projekt i Colombia 2015-2018

description.narrative:
Sverige och det internationella centrumet för övergångsrättvisa (International Center for Transitional Justice - ICTJ) implementerar projektet: "Support to transitional justice initiatives that advance accountability in the context of a complex Peace process in Colombia"övergångsrättsliga initiativ som främjar ansvarsskyldighet i samband med en komplex fredsprocess i Colombia" under perioden mars 2015 – februari 2018.
Projektets huvudmål är att bidra till att stärka konstruktionen och implementationen av övergångsrättvisa i Colombia inom fredsprocessen mellan regeringen och FARC, och numera i linje med fredsavtalet som parterna undertecknade i november 2016.
Projektets specifika mål är:
1) Förbättrad förståelse av övergångsrättsliga åtgärder från civilsamhällesorganisationer, statliga och andra sociala institutioner.
2) Att nationella och regionala aktörer, inkluderat statliga institutioner, deltagarna i fredsförhandlingarna, och civilsamhällesorganisationer utarbetar förslag om rättslig ansvarighet och institutionella reformer som informeras av ICTJ-expertis.
3) Att det offentliga samtalet och beslutsfattande i civilsamhälle och offentlig sektor reflekterar en förståelse för betydelsen av sanningsökande, samt vikten av att etablera en sanningskommission.

Sweden and the International Center for Transitional Justice (ICTJ) are implementing the project "Support to transitional justice initiatives that advance accountability in the context of a complex Peace process in Colombia", during the period March 2015 - February 2018. The main objective of the Project is to contribute to strengthen the design and implementation of transitional justice processes in Colombia within the Peace process between the government and the FARC, and nowadays in line with the Peace agreement signed between the parties on November 2016. The specific objectives of the Project are: 1) Improved understanding of transitional justice measures by civil society organizations, state and other social institutions. 2) National and regional actors, including government stakeholders, parties to the Peace negotiations, and civil society organizations develop proposals on judicial accountability and institutional reforms that are informed by ICTJ expertise. 3) Government and civil society stakeholders debates and decisions reflect an understanding of the importance of a truth-seeking process in Colombia, including a possible truth Commission.

participating-org.narrative: FCG Swedish Development AB (f d Orgut Consulting AB)

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

description.narrative: This is a simplified contribution for a call-off to Sida's framework agreement for evaluation services, to evaluate Sida's funded project "Support to transitional justice initiatives that advance accountability in the context of a complex peace process in Colombia", contribution numer 52060071, implemented by the International Center for Transitional Justice in Colombia. The purpose of the evaluation was to provide inputs to define approaches and priorities for a possible next phase of the project. Two tenders responded to the call-off made by the Embassy and submitted their economic and technical proposals. The proposals were submitted by Framework Consortium led by FCG Sweden and Niras Indevelop. The evaluation of the proposals concluded that FCG Sweden had submitted the economically most advantageous call-off response for the assignment. The evaluation was conducted during January - March 2018. The main results highlighted by the evaluation were: 1. The relevance of the project to the needs and priorities was extremely high. Stakeholders of the project were authorities in the judicial, executive and legislative branches, advisors to the peace negotiators, human rights ' civil society orgnaizations, representatives of the Colombian armed forces and the media. 2. ICTJ achieved results beyond those set in the project's objectives. This applied to all three outcomes established: a) an increased understanding of transitional justice measures among CSO, state and other social institutions; b) feasible proposals on judicial accountability and institutional reforms that were informed by ICTJ expertise; and c) ICTJ's contribution to serious debates and decisions on the importance of the truth-seeking process, including a truth commission. 3. ICTJ's dialogues, trainings, technical assistance and publications contributed to a greater understanding of transitional justice in many ways. This was specially importance since within this period, the government was negotiating a peace agreement with the FARC in which transitional justice was a key component of the agreement. Recommendations to the Embassy and to ICTJ included to improve the gender approach in the upcoming support to ICTJ. Internal training on gender mainstreaming was recommended to ICTJ personnel. Conclusions and recommendations made by the evaluation team are included in the final document " "The key role of ICTJ in the designing of Colombia's complex Transitional Justice System", which was published by Sida as a decentralised evaluation on May 2018.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
